responses: Hello! Welcome to the Acharya Narendra Dev College (ANDC) HelpDesk. How can I assist you today?
Hi there! I can help you with information about ANDC courses, fees, admissions, and campus life. What would you like to know?
Goodbye! Have a great day ahead.
You're welcome! Feel free to come back if you have more questions about ANDC.

patterns: give me an overview of the college
responses: Acharya Narendra Dev College (ANDC), established in 1991, is a premier constituent college of the University of Delhi. Funded by the Govt. of NCT of Delhi, it is known for its strong emphasis on science education and research. It is accredited with an 'A' Grade by NAAC.
The current Principal of Acharya Narendra Dev College is Prof. Ravi Toteja.

patterns: is it a private or govt college
responses: ANDC is a constituent college of the University of Delhi (DU) and is fully funded by the Government of NCT of Delhi.
ANDC is consistently ranked among the top colleges in India. It secured the 18th rank in the NIRF 2024 (College Category) and holds an 'A' Grade accreditation from NAAC.
The college is located at: Govindpuri, Kalkaji, New Delhi - 110019, India.
You can contact the college administration at 011-26294542 or 011-26293224.
The official email for general enquiries is principal@andc.du.ac.in. For admissions, you can often reach out to admissions@andc.du.ac.in.
The official website of Acharya Narendra Dev College is https://www.andcollege.du.ac.in/
The nearest metro station is Govindpuri on the Violet Line. It is approximately 1 km from the college campus.

patterns: what bsc courses do you offer
responses: ANDC offers B.Sc. (Honours) in Biomedical Science, Botany, Chemistry, Computer Science, Electronics, Mathematics, Physics, and Zoology. We also offer B.Sc. Program in Life Sciences and Physical Sciences (with Chemistry, CS, or Electronics).
The college offers B.Com. (Honours) for commerce students. It is one of the premier courses offered by the college.
ANDC offers M.Sc. in Chemistry and M.Sc. in Mathematics.

patterns: do you teach french or german
responses: Yes, the college offers part-time Certificate and Diploma courses in foreign languages including French, German, Spanish, and Russian.

Admission to all UG courses is based on the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) scores, followed by the Common Seat Allocation System (CSAS) by Delhi University. For PG courses, admission is through CUET-PG.

Fees vary by course. Generally, B.Sc. courses range from ₹20,000 to ₹30,000 per year, while B.Sc. (Hons) Computer Science is slightly higher (approx ₹45,000 - ₹50,000+ per year). B.Com (Hons) is around ₹20,000 - ₹25,000 per year. Please check the official prospectus for the exact current session fees.

patterns: is there a boys or girls hostel
responses: ANDC does not have an on-campus hostel. However, many students stay in PG (Paying Guest) accommodations in the nearby areas of Govindpuri and Kalkaji.
Yes, we have a fully computerized library with RFID technology. It houses over 26,000 books, journals, and e-resources. There are separate reading rooms for students and faculty.

The college boasts state-of-the-art laboratories for all science departments, including Physics, Chemistry, Botany, Zoology, Electronics, and Biomedical Science. We also have advanced Computer Labs and a Web Center.
ANDC provides facilities for various sports including Cricket, Football, Basketball, Volleyball, Chess, and Table Tennis. We also have a gymnasium for students.
Yes, ANDC has an active Placement and Career Counseling Cell that organizes recruitment drives, internships, and skill-development workshops.
The average salary package is typically around 3-4 LPA, with the highest going up to 10-12 LPA. Top recruiters include TCS, Wipro, Indigo Airlines, HDFC, and other MNCs.
The college has vibrant cultural societies including 'Dhwani' (Theatre), 'Maa'rur' (Dance), and societies for music, debate, and fine arts.

patterns: what is the annual fest name
responses: The annual cultural festival of Acharya Narendra Dev College is called 'Leiothrixx'. It is a major event with celebrity performances and student competitions.
The college has a hygienic canteen offering a variety of snacks and meals at affordable prices. It is a popular hangout spot for students.
As per Delhi University rules, a minimum of 67% attendance is generally required to be eligible to appear for semester examinations.
You typically need your Class 10th & 12th marksheets, CUET score card, migration certificate, character certificate, caste certificate (if applicable), and passport-sized photographs.
ANDC offers fee concessions and financial aid to needy and deserving students. There are also scholarships like the 'S.K. Batra Memorial Scholarship' and others mandated by DU/Govt.
Yes, the college has a very active NSS unit that engages in social service activities, blood donation camps, and community development.
The entire college campus is Wi-Fi enabled, providing internet access to students and faculty for academic purposes.
ANDC has a zero-tolerance policy towards ragging. An Anti-Ragging Committee is in place to ensure a safe environment for all students.
College classes typically run from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday to Saturday. Administrative office hours are 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM (Mon-Fri).
The Placement Cell and IEDC (Innovation & Entrepreneurship Development Cell) actively assist students in securing summer internships and live projects.
ANDC has a strong alumni network. Our alumni are placed in prestigious research institutes, MNCs, and civil services across the globe.
The college has a medical room with basic first-aid facilities and a visiting doctor/counselor available on specific days.
The Internal Complaints Committee (ICC) deals with issues related to sexual harassment and ensures a safe campus for women. The society 'Sashakt' also works for women's empowerment.

patterns: can i do bsc without maths
responses: Eligibility depends on the specific course (e.g., Physics/Chem/Maths in 12th). Admission is based on CUET subject mapping. Check the latest DU Bulletin of Information for course-specific subject requirements.
For B.Com (Hons), candidates generally need to appear for CUET with Mathematics/Accountancy as a subject. Refer to the CSAS portal for the latest subject combinations.
Yes, there is a stationery and photocopy shop available inside the college campus for student convenience.
The college has a modern, air-conditioned conference hall and seminar rooms equipped with audio-visual aids for events and lectures.
ANDC is unique for promoting undergraduate research. Programmes like 'ELITE' (Education in a Lively Innovative Training Environment) allow students to undertake research projects.
The campus is differently-abled friendly, with ramps, tactile paths, and specialized washrooms. The library also has enabling units for visually challenged students.
There is no full bank branch inside, but several ATMs and banks are located within walking distance in the Kalkaji/Govindpuri market.
The college is well-connected by DTC buses. Buses plying towards Govindpuri, Kalkaji Depot, and Okhla stop near the college.
Each department has its own society, such as the Computer Science Society, Chemistry Society, etc., which organize talks, fests, and workshops throughout the year.
ID cards are issued by the administration office after admission formalities are completed. If lost, please contact the admin office immediately to apply for a duplicate.
Students can access the 'SmartProf' app or the college ERP portal (accessible via the website) to check attendance and internal assessment marks.
The college is named after Acharya Narendra Dev, a great educationist, freedom fighter, and socialist leader of modern India.
The academic calendar is determined by the University of Delhi. Semesters typically start in July/August (Odd) and January (Even). Check the DU website for the official calendar.

The Department of Biomedical Science at ANDC is one of the flagship departments, offering B.Sc. (Hons) Biomedical Science. It has state-of-the-art labs and focuses on immunology, genetics, and biotechnology.
The Computer Science Department offers B.Sc. (Hons) Computer Science and B.Sc. Physical Science (CS). It manages the Web Centre and has multiple high-performance computer labs.
The Department of Electronics offers B.Sc. (Hons) Electronics. It is heavily involved in IEDC projects, robotics, and embedded systems research.
The Chemistry Department offers B.Sc. (Hons) Chemistry and M.Sc. Chemistry. It is equipped with advanced instrumentation labs including spectrophotometers.
The Physics Department offers B.Sc. (Hons) Physics. It emphasizes theoretical and experimental physics, with labs for optics, electronics, and thermal physics.
The Zoology Department offers B.Sc. (Hons) Zoology. It maintains a well-stocked museum and focuses on entomology, ecology, and cell biology.
The Botany Department offers B.Sc. (Hons) Botany. It features a unique herbal garden and a plant tissue culture laboratory.
The Commerce Department runs the B.Com (Hons) program. It organizes seminars on finance, marketing, and taxation regularly.
The Mathematics Department offers B.Sc. (Hons) Mathematics and M.Sc. Mathematics, focusing on algebra, analysis, and computer-oriented numerical methods.
'Dhwani' is the theatre society of ANDC. It performs street plays (Nukkad Natak) and stage plays, winning accolades across DU.
'Sashakt' is the society for women's empowerment. It organizes workshops, self-defense training, and talks on gender issues.
'Tark' is the debating society of ANDC. It organizes annual debate competitions and model united nations (MUN) sessions.
'Picto' is the photography society of ANDC, encouraging students to capture life on campus and organizing photo walks.
'Paritantra' is the Eco Club of ANDC. It manages the paper recycling unit and organizes tree plantation drives.
ANDC is famous for its 'Butterfly Conservatory', a dedicated open area on campus designed to attract and conserve various species of butterflies.
ELITE (Education in a Lively Innovative Training Environment) is ANDC's unique summer fellowship program where students undertake research projects with a stipend.
The Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development Centre (IEDC), funded by DST, promotes startup culture and funds student-led innovative projects.
ANDC functions as a study center for IGNOU (Indira Gandhi National Open University), offering counseling for various courses on weekends.
ANDC is a teaching center for the Non-Collegiate Women's Education Board (NCWEB), conducting classes for BA and BCom on Sundays/breaks.
The Accounts Section deals with fee payments, refunds, and scholarship disbursements. It is located in the Administration Block.
The Principal's Office handles high-level administrative matters. Appointments to meet the Principal can be sought through the PA.
The library is generally open from 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM on weekdays. Timings may vary during exam periods.
Your College ID card works as your Library Card. You can use it to issue text books and access the reference section.
ANDC has a dedicated cricket ground and a competitive cricket team that participates in inter-college DU tournaments.
The college has a football team and practices are held at the sports ground. Trials are usually held at the start of the academic session.

patterns: what is in the canteen menu
responses: The canteen serves affordable meals like Thali, Rajma Chawal, Dosas, Samosas, and beverages. The 'Honey Chilli Potato' is a student favorite.
Admit cards can be downloaded from the DU Samarth Portal before the examinations begin.
Semester results are declared on the official University of Delhi website (exam.du.ac.in) and can also be viewed via the college portal.
Students can apply for revaluation or rechecking of answer scripts through the DU examination branch within the stipulated time after result declaration.
Migration certificates are issued by the Administration Office upon submission of a 'No Dues' clearance form from the library and labs.
Limited parking space is available for students' two-wheelers. Cars are generally not allowed inside the student parking area.
The college has a fully air-conditioned seminar hall equipped with projectors and sound systems for guest lectures and society events.
The Web Center provides internet access to students for project work and research. It is equipped with multiple desktop stations.
Departmental and college-level Freshers' parties are usually organized in August/September to welcome new students.
Farewell parties for final-year students are organized by juniors in April, before the study break begins.
Graduating students can register for the ANDC Alumni Association to stay connected and attend the annual Alumni Meet.
ANDC frequently runs short-term add-on courses in areas like Python, ML, IoT, and Personality Development. Keep an eye on the notice board.
A Grievance Redressal Committee exists to address student complaints regarding academics or infrastructure. You can submit a written complaint to the admin.
The college has a designated Public Information Officer (PIO) for RTI matters. Details are available on the college website under the 'RTI' section.
Internal Assessment (25% of total) includes marks for attendance, class tests, and assignments. These are uploaded on the college ERP.
Medical certificates must be submitted to the college office immediately upon rejoining college to claim attendance benefits.
The annual college magazine 'Insight' features articles, poems, and artwork by students and faculty.
The NSS unit is led by a Programme Officer who coordinates all social service activities. Recruitment usually happens in August.
The Kalkaji Main Market and Govindpuri Market are walking distance from the college, offering food, stationery, and other essentials.
The on-campus photocopy shop offers subsidized rates for students, typically cheaper than outside markets.
